infoText: Statue of Nelson Mandela at the Capetown City Hall.

All the houses in this neighborhood are painted bright colors. Although the neighborhood was occupied by "Africans and coloreds" (still terms used by South Africans today), they were not allowed to own property under Apartheid.  Instead, they leased the houses from white landlords. When the people who lived here were finally allowed to purchase property, they painted the houses bright colors as an expression of their freedom. The houses are repainted regularly, still with bright, vibrant colors.
Nathan Chikoto Recycle Artist Still in the neighborhood. This artists makes art out of recycled materials.
This is a model of neighborhood itself, made out of scrap metal.
From old soft drink cans. You can see the colors of Coca Cola cans in some of them.
